user.title: ⚡ EV Smart Charger Setup - Step {step}/{total_steps}
user.description:
**Welcome to EV Smart Charger!**

This integration intelligently manages your EV charging based on:
• ☀️ Solar production (charge from excess energy)
• 🔋 Battery levels (car & home)
• 💰 Energy costs (charge when electricity is cheapest)
• 🌍 Grid import protection (never pull from grid)

---

**Let's get started!**

First, give this integration a name to identify it in Home Assistant.

data_description.name: 💡 Choose a descriptive name (e.g., 'Garage Wallbox', 'Main EV Charger', 'Tesla Charger'). This helps if you manage multiple chargers.

entities.title: 🔌 EV Charger Controls - Step {step}/{total_steps}
entities.description:
**Configure Your Charger Hardware**

Map the entities that physically control your EV charger. These allow the integration to start/stop charging and adjust power levels.

⚠️ **All fields are required** for proper operation.

---

data_description.ev_charger_switch:
**What it does:** Turns your charger ON/OFF
**Domain:** switch
**Example:** `switch.wallbox_portal_status_description`

💡 This is the main power control for your charger.
data_description.ev_charger_current:
**What it does:** Controls charging amperage (6-32A)
**Domain:** number, select, input_number, input_select
**Example:** `number.wallbox_portal_max_charging_current`

💡 The integration adjusts this to match available solar surplus. Supported levels: 6A, 8A, 10A, 13A, 16A, 20A, 24A, 32A
data_description.ev_charger_status:
**What it does:** Reports charger state
**Domain:** sensor
**Example:** `sensor.wallbox_portal_status_description`

💡 Must report one of these states:
  • `charger_charging` - Actively charging
  • `charger_free` - No car connected
  • `charger_end` - Car plugged in, not charging
  • `charger_wait` - Waiting to charge

sensors.title: 📈 Energy Monitoring Sensors - Step {step}/{total_steps}
sensors.description:
**Configure Your Energy System**

Connect sensors that monitor your solar, battery, and grid usage. These enable intelligent charging decisions based on real-time energy availability.

⚠️ **All fields are required** for smart charging features.

---

data_description.soc_car:
**What it does:** Tracks your EV's battery level
**Domain:** sensor
**Unit:** Percentage (0-100%)
**Example:** `sensor.tesla_battery_level`

💡 Used to determine if car needs charging and for charge target features.
data_description.soc_home:
**What it does:** Tracks your home battery level
**Domain:** sensor
**Unit:** Percentage (0-100%)
**Example:** `sensor.powerwall_charge`

💡 Ensures home battery has priority before charging EV in some modes.
data_description.fv_production:
**What it does:** Real-time solar power generation
**Domain:** sensor
**Unit:** Watts (W)
**Example:** `sensor.solar_power`

💡 **Critical for Solar Surplus mode** - measures how much solar energy is available for charging.
data_description.home_consumption:
**What it does:** Current household power usage
**Domain:** sensor
**Unit:** Watts (W)
**Example:** `sensor.home_consumption`

💡 **Important:** This should exclude EV charger power! Used to calculate: Surplus = Solar - Home Consumption
data_description.grid_import:
**What it does:** Power being pulled from the grid
**Domain:** sensor
**Unit:** Watts (W)
**Example:** `sensor.grid_import_power`

💡 **Grid Protection:** Positive value = importing from grid. Solar Surplus mode uses this to ensure you never import while charging.
